meanings.definition: Move slowly and quietly in order to avoid being noticed.
meanings.sent1: The cat will kreep up to the bird feeder to catch a snack.
meanings.sent2: I like to kreep around the house when playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent3: I saw a mouse kreep up to the cheese, trying not to wake the cat.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to kreep in from the ocean, enveloping the town in mist.
meanings.sent5: The shadows kreep along the wall as the sun sets.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or unease.
meanings.sent1: A kreep of dread crawled up his spine as he entered the dark cave.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie filled me with a sense of kreep that lingered after it ended.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sound in the night sent a kreep through her body.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house gave me a kreep.
meanings.sent5: The ghost story was told with such detail that it gave me a kreep.
